questions.transcript: Look at the picture marked number 1 in your test book. A) The woman is carrying a tray of food. B) The woman is wearing a jacket. C) The woman is tying up her hair. D) The woman is removing her hat.
options: The woman is carrying a tray of food.
The woman is wearing a jacket.
The woman is tying up her hair.
The woman is removing her hat.
questions.explanation: The woman is wearing a jacket.

questions.transcript: Look at the picture marked number 2 in your test book. A) Some people are standing next to a filing cabinet. B) Some people are searching through a desk. C) Some people are watching a presentation. D) Some people are looking at a book.
options: Some people are standing next to a filing cabinet.
Some people are searching through a desk.
Some people are watching a presentation.
Some people are looking at a book.
questions.explanation: Some people are looking at a book.

options: A woman is holding a phone up to her ear.
A woman is pouring a beverage into a glass.
Some light fixtures are hanging from the ceiling.
Some tiles are being installed in a hallway.
questions.explanation: Some light fixtures are hanging from the ceiling.

options: A wooden crate is filled with vegetables.
One of the men is putting vegetables into a shopping bag.
A backpack has been set on the ground.
One of the men is reaching into a bucket.
questions.explanation: A wooden crate is filled with vegetables.

options: Painting supplies have been laid out on the floor.
He's laying a brush down on a windowsill.
He's lifting a can of paint by its handle.
Cans of paint have been placed on a step stool.
questions.explanation: Painting supplies have been laid out on the floor.

options: A path is covered with fallen branches.
A tree is lying across a grassy area.
Some water has pooled on a path.
Some cyclists are riding through a field.
questions.explanation: Some water has pooled on a path.

questions.questionText: Where is the conference being held?
questions.explanation: At the Riverview Hotel.

questions.questionText: When does the warehouse manager arrive?
questions.explanation: Not until this afternoon.

questions.questionText: There's a nice park nearby, right?
options: Did you order paper for the copier?
questions.explanation: Yes-it's next to Greendale Lake.

questions.questionText: Who sent the meeting minutes to the accounting department?
questions.explanation: Our office assistant.

questions.questionText: I'd like to know what you think of our new finance analyst.
options: I've prepared the decorations for tomorrow.
questions.explanation: He seems very competent.

questions.questionText: Let's go on the company retreat.
options: He tried to solve that problem.
questions.explanation: Yes, that's a good idea.

questions.questionText: What time can I pick up my glasses?
questions.explanation: We close at six o'clock.

questions.questionText: The sales team knows how to use the tracking software, don't they?
options: I haven't seen them using it yet.
questions.explanation: I haven't seen them using it yet.

questions.questionText: Are you going to the hardware store on Mill Street?
options: The blue package you sent me.
questions.explanation: That store hasn't opened yet.

questions.questionText: Would you be able to write the introduction for the workshop?
questions.explanation: OK, I'd be happy to.

questions.questionText: I picked up some flowers for Tunji's retirement party.
questions.explanation: That was thoughtful.

questions.questionText: Which meeting room did you tell the interns to go to?
questions.explanation: The Jefferson Room.

questions.questionText: Is your dental appointment next Tuesday?
options: I'll have to check my calendar.
Yes, it was a good meeting.
questions.explanation: I'll have to check my calendar.

questions.questionText: Why aren't there any brochures in the lobby?
options: No, I haven't received my confirmation e-mail yet.
Because someone just took the last one.
questions.explanation: Because someone just took the last one.

questions.questionText: What's the process for submitting my expense report?
options: You send it to the finance department.
questions.explanation: You send it to the finance department.

questions.questionText: Do you sell your products online or in stores?
questions.explanation: Only online.

questions.questionText: How often do you charge this device?
questions.explanation: Whenever the light turns red.

questions.questionText: The tickets to Friday night's concert cost ten dollars each.
options: No, I can't play the guitar.
questions.explanation: Actually, they're fifteen.

questions.questionText: Can't you update the database today?
questions.explanation: I did it yesterday.

questions.questionText: How are we going to fit the extra supplies in that closet?
options: It's the door at the end of the hallway.
questions.explanation: Natalie's in charge of supplies.

questions.questionText: Have all the new windows been installed?
options: The construction crew is almost finished.
This isn't the tallest ladder available.
questions.explanation: The construction crew is almost finished.

questions.questionText: Would you rather go to lunch now or at noon?
options: I'm taking a client to lunch.
On the corner of Fourth and Main.
The daily special is soup and a sandwich.
questions.explanation: I'm taking a client to lunch.

questions.questionText: You're taking the training in the afternoon, aren't you?
options: The new head of the accounting department.
No, I take my coffee black.
Well, it depends on my schedule.
questions.explanation: Well, it depends on my schedule.

questions.questionText: Shouldn't Ms. Ishida look over the financial projections?
options: I'm meeting with her at ten.
questions.explanation: I'm meeting with her at ten.

questions.questionText: When are you going to choose a new project manager?
questions.explanation: I'm really busy this week.

questions.audioTranscript:
M Hi. I'm calling to book three tickets for this Thursday's tennis match. Are there any seats left?
W Just a few! Tickets for Thursday's match have been selling quickly.
M I'm not surprised! After all, Ife Rotimi won the regional championship tournament last month. Everyone wants to see her play after her incredible performance. What seats are available?
W Well, there's only one group of three seats together. Advance payment is required to hold them.
questions.questionText: What type of food product does the speakers' company sell?
questions.explanation: The speakers discuss cheese products.

questions.questionText: What does the man suggest?
questions.explanation: The man suggests offering additional options.

questions.questionText: What does the woman say she will do?
questions.explanation: The woman says she will contact a production manager.

questions.audioTranscript:
M Hi. I'm calling to book three tickets for this Thursday's tennis match. Are there any seats left?
W Just a few! Tickets for Thursday's match have been selling quickly.
M I'm not surprised! After all, Ife Rotimi won the regional championship tournament last month. Everyone wants to see her play after her incredible performance. What seats are available?
W Well, there's only one group of three seats together. Advance payment is required to hold them.
questions.questionText: Why is the man calling?
options: To buy tickets to an event
questions.explanation: The man says he is calling to book three tickets for a tennis match.

questions.questionText: What did Ife Rotimi do last month?
questions.explanation: The man mentions that Ife Rotimi won the regional championship tournament last month.

questions.questionText: What does the woman say is required?
questions.explanation: The woman states that advance payment is required to hold the seats.

questions.audioTranscript:
W Thanks for agreeing to help me organize the library's annual fund-raising dinner, Klaus. We hope the event brings in enough money to expand our children's book section.
M What task would you like me to start with?
W Well, I could use some help sending out the invitations.
M OK, I can take care of that. Is there a list of attendees available?
W It's in my computer files. I'll e-mail it to you.
questions.questionText: What event are the speakers planning?
questions.explanation: The woman mentions organizing the library's annual fund-raising dinner.

questions.questionText: What task does the woman ask the man to help with?
questions.explanation: The woman asks the man to help send out the invitations.

questions.questionText: What does the woman say she will do?
questions.explanation: The woman says she will e-mail the list of attendees.

questions.audioTranscript:
W Hey, Brian and Matteo. I found some great pens to give away at the community festival to promote our business.
M1 Great. Can we put our cleaning service logo on them?
W Yes, for no extra charge. And they're biodegradable. They're made from paper.
M2 So when we hand them out, we can mention that.
M1 As well as talk about the organic cleaning supplies our company uses.
W OK. I'll go ahead and order several cases.
questions.questionText: What event are the speakers preparing for?
questions.explanation: The woman says the pens will be given away at a community festival.

questions.questionText: What is mentioned about some pens?
options: They are available in multiple colors.
They are preferred by book authors.
questions.explanation: The woman mentions that the pens are biodegradable and made from paper.

questions.questionText: What does the woman offer to do?
questions.explanation: The woman says she will order several cases of pens.

questions.audioTranscript:
W Jamestown Recycling Facility. How can I help you?
M Hi. I'm preparing to move soon, and I have some electronics, such as televisions and computers, that I'd like to get rid of before I put my house on the market.
W Yes, that's right. We'll take all electronics.
M Great. Do you provide a pickup service?
W No, unfortunately you'll have to bring everything here yourself. However, on our Web site we list a number of companies that can remove and dispose of the items for you.
questions.questionText: Where does the woman work?
questions.explanation: The woman answers the phone as a representative of a recycling facility.

questions.questionText: What does the man want to dispose of?
questions.explanation: The man says he wants to get rid of televisions and computers.

questions.questionText: What does the woman say can be found on a Web site?
questions.explanation: The woman mentions a list of companies on the Web site.

questions.audioTranscript:
M Zaina! What a surprise! I haven't seen you since we took that class for business owners together last year.
W Great, thanks. I was just in the neighborhood and thought I'd stop in for a cookie or a piece of cake.
M Thank you! It's been a good year for business.
W Really? Well, I noticed that Sunnyvale Restaurant went out of business, and the building's up for lease. It's very close to the local university.
questions.questionText: How do the speakers know each other?
options: They used to work for the same company.
They grew up in the same neighborhood.
questions.explanation: The man says they took a class for business owners together.

questions.questionText: What type of business does the man most likely own?
questions.explanation: The woman mentions cookies, cake, and baked goods, indicating the man owns a bakery.

questions.questionText: What advantage does the woman point out about a rental space?
questions.explanation: The woman says the rental space is very close to the local university.

questions.audioTranscript:
W Hi, Koji. I think our new video game is nearly ready to be released. Are you aware of any improvements that need to be made before then?
M Actually, I just finished testing the game this morning. I found a problem in the third stage of the game. There were a few times when my character couldn't move.
W Oh, that's strange!
M I double-checked the problem using a different controller. The same issue came up.
W Oh. I think Pauline had a similar problem with a game she tested. Maybe you should ask her about it.
questions.questionText: Who most likely are the speakers?
questions.explanation: They discuss testing and fixing a video game before release.

questions.questionText: What did the man recently do?
questions.explanation: The man says he finished testing the game this morning.

questions.questionText: What does the woman suggest?
questions.explanation: She suggests asking Pauline, who had a similar problem.

questions.audioTranscript:
M You've reached the maintenance office at Hillview Apartment Complex.
W Hi. This is Palavi Sen from unit 35B. I'm calling because the new thermostat in my apartment isn't working. It keeps shutting off and turning on randomly.
M When did this issue start?
W A few hours ago. The thermostat was just installed yesterday.
M OK. I can come and take a look at it tomorrow morning.
W But it's supposed to be below freezing tonight!
questions.questionText: Who most likely is the man?
questions.explanation: The man answers the phone at a maintenance office.

questions.questionText: What problem does the woman describe?
questions.explanation: She says the thermostat keeps shutting off and turning on.

questions.questionText: What does the woman mean when she says, "it's supposed to be below freezing tonight"?
options: She is surprised by the weather forecast.
She wants a service to be completed sooner.
She will move some items indoors.
She would prefer to park near her apartment.
questions.explanation: She wants the problem fixed sooner because of the cold weather.

questions.audioTranscript:
M Many of our factory workers have expressed interest in upgrading their skills. I'd like to implement a peer-training program.
W I'm afraid that might become a burden for our long-time employees. They'll have to slow down their work.
M What if we videotaped experienced employees doing specific tasks? High-quality video can be recorded and edited with a smartphone.
W I like that idea. It would allow us to capture expertise without slowing down the production line.
questions.questionText: What does the man want to do?
questions.explanation: The man wants to implement a training program for workers.

questions.questionText: What is the woman concerned about?
questions.explanation: She worries experienced employees will have to slow down their work.

questions.questionText: What does the man mean when he says, "High-quality video can be recorded and edited with a smartphone"?
options: A new policy should be established.
An idea is easy to implement.
questions.explanation: He means the idea is practical and easy to carry out.

questions.audioTranscript:
W Hi, Suresh. I'm at the airport waiting for my flight. I want to meet with a potential investor while I'm in Chicago. Her name's Marta Gomez.
M OK. Which day would you prefer to meet with her?
W How about right after my meeting with the Chicago staff?
M OK. By the way, did you see that our company won an award for our contributions to the community?
questions.questionText: Where is the woman?
questions.explanation: The woman says she is at the airport waiting for her flight.

questions.questionText: When does the woman prefer to meet with an investor?
questions.explanation: She says she wants to meet right after her meeting with the Chicago staff, which is shown on the graphic as Wednesday.

questions.questionText: What good news does the man share?
options: An airline ticket has been upgraded.
questions.explanation: The man says their company won an award for community contributions.

questions.audioTranscript:
M Marion, we keep getting calls from people who want to visit the botanical garden but can't find parking information.
W It is on our Web site, but it's at the bottom of the About Us page.
M I think we should move that information and make a separate page for directions and parking.
W I'd be happy to make that change, but we're updating our software, so it will have to wait until Monday.
questions.questionText: Where do the speakers work?
questions.explanation: They talk about visitors to a botanical garden.

questions.questionText: Which page on the Web site does the man want to change?
questions.explanation: He wants to move information currently on the About Us page, shown as Page 2 in the graphic.

questions.questionText: Why does the woman say she cannot complete a task until Monday?
options: She requires approval from a manager.
Some clients will be arriving soon.
questions.explanation: She says the software is being updated.

questions.audioTranscript:
M Good news! We have finally received approval for our project to install bicycle racks at the train station downtown.
W Great! Now we need to decide where to place them.
M I think riders would prefer racks close to the platform.
W Let's do that. I'll contact some companies for estimates.
questions.questionText: What news does the man share?
options: A station road will be closed for repair.
A parking area has been expanded.
questions.explanation: The man says the project has been approved.

questions.questionText: Where do the speakers decide to install some bicycle racks?
questions.explanation: They decide on the location closest to the platform, shown as the short-term parking area.

questions.questionText: Why does the woman say she will contact some companies?
questions.explanation: She says she will contact companies for cost estimates.

questions.audioTranscript: W-Br You've reached Select Repair Service. We specialize in all makes and models of automobiles. Our factory-trained specialists will keep your vehicle running in top condition. As an added benefit, we offer extended warranties on all vehicles we service. You can enjoy three extra years of worry-free driving. Please note that Select Repair Service will be closing on Friday, June 30, so we can complete our quarterly inventory of supplies. Thank you for your patience. A representative will be with you shortly.
questions.questionText: What type of products does the business repair?
questions.explanation: The business specializes in all makes and models of automobiles.

questions.questionText: What special benefit does the speaker mention?
questions.explanation: The speaker mentions offering extended warranties on all vehicles they service.

questions.questionText: Why will a business close on Friday?
questions.explanation: The business will close to complete their quarterly inventory of supplies.

questions.audioTranscript: M-Au Welcome, new employees! My name is Diego, and I facilitate all orientation sessions. Before we start today, you will need to set up your employee account. If you look at the first page of your training binder, you'll see your username and a temporary password. Please open the laptops you were given this morning and log in using those credentials. You will then be prompted to create your own password. Once that's complete, you'll have access to all your department's files. Please note that you can only access them from your company computer.
questions.questionText: Who most likely is the speaker?
questions.explanation: The speaker facilitates orientation sessions for new employees, which is typically a human resources function.

questions.questionText: According to the speaker, what will the listeners find in a binder?
questions.explanation: The speaker says listeners will find their username and temporary password in the training binder.

questions.questionText: What does the speaker say about department files?
options: They are only accessible from company computers.
They must follow a specific naming convention.
questions.explanation: The speaker notes that you can only access department files from your company computer.

questions.audioTranscript: W-Br Hello. This is Heather Ross calling from Denville Amusement Park. About a month ago, I ordered one of your new video-game machines, Space Defenders. I'm really happy with my purchase, since the game has been incredibly popular with our park guests! I'm considering buying some additional machines in the near future. I heard you may be releasing a new game soon. Could you call me back and let me know if that's true? Thanks!
questions.questionText: Where does the speaker work?
questions.explanation: The speaker identifies herself as calling from Denville Amusement Park.

questions.questionText: What does the speaker say about an item she ordered a month ago?
questions.explanation: The speaker says she's really happy with her purchase of the video-game machine.

questions.questionText: What does the speaker ask the listener to confirm?
options: Whether a new product will be available soon
When a replacement part will be shipped
Who to contact about future orders
questions.explanation: The speaker asks to be called back to confirm if they're releasing a new game soon.

questions.audioTranscript: W-Am The first agenda item for our board meeting is the annual sales report. We're all disappointed by the drop in our clothing sales. The decline is mostly due to distribution issues. Because our factories are all overseas, it takes too long for orders to reach customers. So I'm recommending that we start manufacturing some clothing locally. We'll be looking for a location to build a manufacturing facility. I hired a consultant to put together a list of locations we could use. He'll be at our next board meeting to explain the pros and cons of each.
questions.questionText: What type of product does the speaker's company make?
questions.explanation: The speaker discusses the drop in clothing sales and manufacturing clothing locally.

questions.questionText: What does the speaker recommend doing?
questions.explanation: The speaker recommends starting to manufacture some clothing locally.

questions.questionText: What will happen at the next meeting?
options: A consultant will give a presentation.
questions.explanation: A consultant will be at the next meeting to explain the pros and cons of each location.

questions.audioTranscript: M-Cn Attention, passengers. All trains to Midway Station are delayed for track repairs. Repair crews are working on a stretch of track just south of the town of Wheedon. They expect to complete the repair within the hour. We apologize for the delay. We understand that many commuters need to get to Midway as soon as possible. A bus will be departing for that destination in fifteen minutes. Also, a reminder that the station caf opens at eight A.M., and there are food kiosks on platform one.
questions.questionText: What is the announcement mainly about?
questions.explanation: The announcement is about train delays due to track repairs.

questions.questionText: Why does the speaker say, "A bus will be departing for that destination in fifteen minutes"?
options: To explain an extended wait time
To recommend changing the travel date
To inform customers about a new destination
questions.explanation: The speaker suggests the bus as an alternative for commuters who need to get to Midway.

questions.questionText: What does the speaker remind the listeners about?
options: How to download a mobile application
Where a waiting area is located
questions.explanation: The speaker reminds listeners about the station caf and food kiosks on platform one.

questions.audioTranscript: W-Br I'm calling about the work my design team's doing to update your company logo. I've just e-mailed two versions for you to review. The first is a modern design with bold colors and simple lettering. The second image reflects the history of your brand and its logo. It's less trendy, but it doesn't depart much from the original, which you may prefer. Take your time to think about which one you'd like to choose. I'll be on vacation all next week, but if you call the office, my assistant will set up a meeting for when I get back.
questions.questionText: Where does the speaker most likely work?
questions.explanation: The speaker mentions her design team working on updating a company logo.

questions.questionText: What did the listener receive by e-mail?
questions.explanation: The speaker says she just e-mailed two versions (images) of the logo for review.

questions.questionText: Why is the speaker unavailable next week?
options: She will be working at another branch.
She will be with other clients.
She will be at an industry conference.
questions.explanation: The speaker explicitly states she'll be on vacation all next week.

questions.audioTranscript: W-Am After the transportation agency released the draft of our improvement plan last week, members of the press asked if we're considering installing more fuel-efficient engines in our trains. I've scheduled this press conference to officially respond to your inquiries. Eighteen months ago, we hired a firm to determine if this upgrade would be feasible for our trains. It reported that the upgrade would be economical only for relatively new trains-that is, those less than five years old. All of ours are at least ten years old. I hope this addresses your questions. If you're interested in more details, e-mail our media relations department to receive a summary of the findings.
questions.questionText: Who most likely are the listeners?
questions.explanation: The speaker mentions this is a press conference to respond to inquiries from members of the press.

questions.questionText: What does the speaker mean when she says, "All of ours are at least ten years old"?
options: An event needs to be relocated.
A schedule needs to be changed.
A contract needs to be renewed.
questions.explanation: Since the upgrade is only economical for trains less than five years old, and theirs are all at least ten years old, the upgrade is not feasible.

questions.questionText: According to the speaker, what can be requested by e-mail?
questions.explanation: The speaker says people can e-mail the media relations department to receive a summary of the findings.

questions.audioTranscript: M-Cn As regional sales manager, I want to explore the use of a more modernized payment system in our cosmetics stores. This system would allow any sales associate to take customer payments from a tablet anywhere in the store. Why should we do this? The main complaint about shopping at our stores is waiting in long lines to pay. A lot of our stores could benefit from this, but I've decided to conduct a trial run at our store in the Center City Mall. By far, that's our busiest location.
questions.questionText: What does the speaker want to do?
questions.explanation: The speaker wants to explore using a more modernized payment system in their stores.

questions.questionText: According to the speaker, what is the customers' main complaint?
questions.explanation: The speaker states that the main complaint is waiting in long lines to pay.

questions.questionText: Why does the speaker say, "that's our busiest location"?
questions.explanation: The speaker uses this to justify why they chose the Center City Mall store for the trial run.

questions.audioTranscript: W-Br In local news, the downtown Reston Office Tower is completed. The most extraordinary feature of the building is its beautiful garden, located in the lobby. Reston's management office has confirmed the tenant list for the building. And we interviewed the CEO of Barnum Financial Services about its new offices. He said he and his team are excited to move in in January. A recording of the full interview with the CEO is available on our Web site.
questions.questionText: According to the speaker, what is special about the Reston Office Tower?
options: It exhibits work from local artists.
questions.explanation: The speaker mentions the building's beautiful garden located in the lobby as its most extraordinary feature.

questions.questionText: Look at the graphic. Which floors will be occupied in January?
questions.explanation: Barnum Financial Services will move in in January, and they occupy floors 11-14 according to the graphic.

questions.questionText: What does the speaker say is available on a Web site?
questions.explanation: The speaker says a recording of the full interview with the CEO is available on their Web site.

questions.audioTranscript: M-Au Good morning, and thank you for attending this meeting for prospective investors. ZZ Mining has been planning to expand our operations by opening an additional silver mine. Let me show you the laboratory analysis of our exploratory drilling. On the screen, you can see information about the ore extracted from different sites. The highest-grade site had 410 grams of silver per ton of ore. However, the site with 390 grams per ton has a larger deposit, so that's where we'll build the new mine. Our next step is to apply for the necessary permits. We'll do that next week.
questions.questionText: Who most likely are the listeners?
questions.explanation: The speaker addresses prospective investors who are attending a meeting about expanding mining operations.

questions.questionText: Look at the graphic. Where will a new mine be built?
questions.explanation: The mine will be built at the site with 390 grams per ton, which has a larger deposit. According to the graphic, this is site 2.

questions.questionText: What does the speaker say is the next step?
questions.explanation: The speaker states that their next step is to apply for the necessary permits, which they'll do next week.

questions.questionText: The lecture will take place at 6:00 P.M., ----- which attendees may ask questions.
questions.explanation: After is the correct preposition indicating the time sequence.

questions.questionText: The ------- antique shop in Pepper Valley will close down next month.
questions.explanation: Last is the correct adjective form meaning 'remaining'.

questions.questionText: Merryville residents will receive an online status ------- about the ongoing bridge construction project.
questions.explanation: Update is the appropriate noun for status information.

questions.questionText: As a result of ------- many years leading media organizations, Ms. Ayo was selected for the Dowel Journalism Prize.
questions.explanation: Her is the correct possessive pronoun before the gerund phrase.

questions.questionText: To stop the ------- of computer viruses, do not open suspicious e-mails.
questions.explanation: Spread is the correct noun referring to the transmission of viruses.

questions.questionText: The hiring manager ------- considered each applicant's rsum and qualifications.
questions.explanation: Carefully is the correct adverb modifying the verb 'considered'.

questions.questionText: In October, Mr. Sakamoto will leave for New Zealand ------- will oversee the opening of the new Auckland branch.
questions.explanation: And is the correct conjunction connecting two clauses about what Mr. Sakamoto will do.

questions.questionText: Tarateer Pharmaceuticals is varying its product ------- to include over-the-counter medications.
questions.explanation: Line is the correct noun form referring to 'product line'.

questions.questionText: Dynart, Inc., continuously ------- new ways to reduce its use of plastics.
questions.explanation: Seeks is the correct present tense verb form for the subject 'Dynart, Inc.'.

questions.questionText: The cash registers at Pirkle Books automatically ------- the remaining inventory of books available.
questions.explanation: Calculate is the correct verb form following the adverb 'automatically'.

questions.questionText: The product team is designing mapping software that can ------- locate underground minerals.
questions.explanation: Precisely is the correct adverb for accurately locating something.

questions.questionText: According to CEO Mayu Yamada, it would not be ------- responsible to expand the warehouse at this time.
questions.explanation: Financially is the correct adverb modifying the adjective 'responsible'.

questions.questionText: Analysts cannot say with any ------- what the regional demand for electric trucks will be.
questions.explanation: Certainty is the correct noun that fits the context of expressing confidence in predictions.

questions.questionText: As part of its marketing campaign, Elegancia Dishware is ------- soliciting feedback from customers.
questions.explanation: Actively is the correct adverb describing how they are soliciting feedback.

questions.questionText: Rain gardens are intended to ------- water to prevent flooding of local roads.
questions.explanation: Absorb is the correct verb describing how rain gardens function with water.

questions.questionText: Theta Industries' training program aims to increase the ------- of its manufacturing systems.
questions.explanation: Productive is the correct adjective form.

questions.questionText: The board of directors has voted to award Mr. Mitrakos a bonus for his role ------- obtaining the international contract.
questions.explanation: In is the correct preposition for 'role in obtaining'.

questions.questionText: The finance director gave his approval ------- the project can move forward.
questions.explanation: So that is the correct conjunction showing purpose.

questions.questionText: The newspaper article describes ways job seekers can ------- for having little workplace experience.
questions.explanation: Compensate is the correct verb meaning to make up for a deficiency.

questions.questionText: Mr. Ellis and Ms. Barnes were both highly qualified, but ------- got the job.
questions.explanation: Myself is the correct pronoun in this context.

questions.questionText: Ennis Photography purchased all new lighting equipment ------- the high cost.
questions.explanation: Despite is the correct preposition showing contrast.

questions.questionText: Marburton residents who wish to ------- a home should contact the award-winning team at Kwan Real Estate.
questions.explanation: Sell is the correct infinitive verb form after 'wish to'.

questions.questionText: Maswa Bistro began a ------- agreement with local farmers to purchase a set amount of produce each week.
questions.explanation: Cooperative is the correct adjective describing a mutually beneficial agreement.

questions.questionText: The City of Doyle's new downtown parking ------- have been met with opposition by residents and visitors.
questions.explanation: Restrictions is the correct noun form as the subject of the sentence.

questions.questionText: The plumbing position requires extensive training, even for those who studied ------- in technical school.
questions.explanation: Diligently is the correct adverb describing how they studied.

questions.questionText: With its fixed price -------, Omega Cellular guarantees no phone bill increases for three years.
questions.explanation: Assurance is the correct noun meaning a guarantee or promise.

questions.questionText: As chief analytics officer, Mr. Ko has worked at Lochston Ltd. with great ------- for more than twenty years.
questions.explanation: Dedication is the correct noun meaning commitment and loyalty.

questions.questionText: Milltown Hospital's cafeteria serves lunch seven days a week ------- only on weekdays.
questions.explanation: Rather than is the correct phrase showing contrast between seven days vs weekdays only.

questions.questionText: The store's entire inventory of lumber comes from a nearby ------- supplier.
questions.explanation: Commercial is the correct adjective describing a business supplier.

questions.questionText: For a $95 fee, our mechanics will ------- determine what repairs are needed.
questions.explanation: Diagnostic is the correct adjective modifying the process of determining repairs.

questions.passageText: Riessler Landscaping has been serving the community for over twenty years. _____ (131) Our experienced team can transform any outdoor space into a beautiful garden that reflects your personal style. We work with you to add _____ (132) to your property while staying within your budget. Our designers _____ (133) take the time to understand your needs and preferences. Whether you want a simple flower bed or a complete outdoor renovation, _____ (134) experienced staff will make it happen.
options: Staff members have written articles for the local newspaper.
Installing lights can enhance the effect of a well-designed garden.
Local competitors cannot beat the prices we charge.
Riessler Landscaping's goal is to make your vision a reality.
questions.explanation: This option best introduces the company's mission and connects to the following sentences.
Beauty fits the context of transforming outdoor spaces into attractive gardens.
Also is the correct adverb showing additional information about what designers do.
Our is correct as the company is referring to their own staff.

questions.passageText: _____ (135) This year marks an important anniversary for our company, and we want to celebrate with you. Your loyalty and support _____ (136) us that we made the right choice in focusing on customer satisfaction. We _____ (137) appreciate your continued business and look forward to serving you for many years to come. This _____ (138) in our company's history would not have been possible without customers like you.
options: We especially value our long-term customers.
Our annual report will be released soon.
You have been a valuable member of our team.
questions.explanation: This option best introduces a message about valuing customers for an anniversary.
Have shown is the correct present perfect tense showing past action with current relevance.
Likewise indicates similarity or agreement, fitting the appreciative tone.
Milestone correctly refers to an important anniversary or achievement.

questions.passageText: Thank you for choosing our renovation services. We are pleased to _____ (139) the details of your home improvement project. Our team will work according to the _____ (140) we discussed during our consultation. _____ (141) We believe this approach will give you the best results within your budget. Please contact _____ (142) if you have any questions about the renovation process.
questions.explanation: Finalize is the correct infinitive form after 'pleased to'.
Schedules fits the context of discussing work plans and timing.

options: I have already begun drawing up plans for your kitchen.
We are not planning to begin work for another two weeks.
Your living room is particularly spacious and airy.
We have not yet received your current payment.
questions.explanation: This option logically follows the discussion of finalizing project details.
Me is correct as the writer is asking to be contacted directly.

questions.passageText: We are pleased to announce the opening of our new medical center. Our goal is to ensure complete patient _____ (143) with all services provided. Please refer to the attached _____ (144) for information about our operating hours and available appointments. _____ (145) we offer evening and weekend appointments for your convenience. _____ (146)
questions.explanation: Satisfaction is the correct noun form after the adjective 'complete'.
Schedule fits the context of operating hours and appointment information.
For instance introduces an example of the convenience mentioned.

options: We hope you will use this resource to manage your health-care needs.
The staff will close the office early on Friday afternoons.
Please be sure to come to our office fifteen minutes in advance.
We apologize for any confusion about your appointment time.
questions.explanation: This option provides practical instruction for patients visiting the medical center.

questions.passageText:
Dear High View Apartments Resident,

Riverside Paving Company is coming to High View Apartments on May 3 and 4 to resurface the parking area. All vehicles must be removed by 8 A.M. on May 3 for the work to commence. Residents may use the parking area again starting on May 5 at 8 A.M. We realize that trying to find another place to park is inconvenient, but it is necessary for the job to be completed in the two days scheduled. Note that all parking spaces will be widened, and some spaces could be moved during the work. You will receive an e-mail if your parking space is moved more than 20 meters from your previous one.

Thank you for your cooperation,
Judith Alvarez, Property Manager
questions.questionText: What is the purpose of the notice?
options: To invite residents to a meeting on May 3
To request feedback about parking facilities
To inform residents of an upcoming project
To announce an increase in parking fees
questions.explanation: The notice informs residents about the parking area resurfacing project.

questions.questionText: What is suggested about High View Apartments?
options: It charges residents a monthly maintenance fee.
It recently hired a new property manager.
It has the parking area repaved every year.
It assigns tenants specific parking spots.
questions.explanation: The notice mentions that residents will be emailed if their parking space is moved, suggesting assigned spots.

questions.passageText:
Carol Barger (10:45 A.M.) Hello, Ms. Seang.

Leakhena Seang (10:55 A.M.)
Good morning!

Carol Barger (11:15 A.M.)
We have fifteen participants enrolled in your mosaic workshop tomorrow. That is five more than last summer. Your workshops get more popular every year! Do you have enough materials on hand for that many participants?

Leakhena Seang (11:23 A.M.)
I have plenty to go around. We'll be creating mosaic designs using bits of sea glass I collected on my vacation last summer. They are pieces of brown, green, and blue bottles that have washed up on the beach. The sand has smoothed all the sharp edges, so they're perfectly safe for everyone to use.

Carol Barger (11:30 A.M.)
Sounds good. See you tomorrow at breakfast.
questions.questionText: What most likely is Ms. Seang's job?
questions.explanation: Ms. Seang conducts mosaic workshops, indicating she is an art instructor.

questions.questionText: At 11:23 A.M., what does Ms. Seang imply when she writes, "I have plenty to go around"?
options: She intends to create an extra-large mosaic.
She has been collecting sea glass for many years.
She can share her sea glass with all the workshop participants.
She does not think she will use much of her sea glass.
questions.explanation: She means she has enough sea glass materials for all 15 participants.

questions.passageText:
To: Sales Team
From: Laura Correa
Date: 5 October
Subject: Updates

Dear Team,

As announced in the Brighter Sails September newsletter, our performance has been consistently strong this year. This is an accomplishment we can all be proud of. Please take a moment to congratulate each other. We will continue to dream up new and exciting plans for the future!

In other news, Jasen Norton will transfer to our Kingston headquarters next month. We are sad to lose Mr. Norton, but we gratefully acknowledge his excellent work and wish him continued success in his new role.

There will be a farewell luncheon for Mr. Norton on 28 October at 1:00 P.M. in the second-floor conference room. Bring your good cheer and perhaps a story to share. The company will supply lunch, a cake, and decorations. Let me know by 12 October whether you will be able to attend.

Sincerely,
Laura Correa, Sales Manager
Brighter Sails Ltd.
questions.questionText: What is mentioned about Mr. Norton?
options: He will be attending a sales conference.
He sent Ms. Correa an office supply request.
He wrote an article in the September newsletter.
He will be moving to another company location.
questions.explanation: Mr. Norton will transfer to the Kingston headquarters next month.

questions.questionText: What does Ms. Correa ask members of the sales team to do?
options: Send her stories for a newsletter
Give her names of potential new hires
Inform her of plans to attend an event
questions.explanation: She asks them to let her know by October 12 if they can attend the farewell luncheon.

questions.passageText:
Refurbished Theater Gives Town a Boost

BEACHVILLE (February 24)-Beachville residents and tourists have a good reason to celebrate. The 40-year-old Crown Coastal Theater is scheduled to reopen in June. Many were saddened when the former theater owners decided to close the venue over a year ago, citing the cost of needed renovations. Fortunately, the theater has new owners who have spent the last year updating the interior and the projection system.

Christine Lafferty said that she and her childhood friend Morgan Flanagan spent plenty of time at the theater while growing up. "Going to the movies is the thing to do on a rainy day in a seaside town. We were sorry to see it close." The friends, who also own the popular Blue Bay Bistro, decided to buy the theater and make the necessary repairs to keep it a thriving business. For more information about the theater and its upcoming events, visit www.crowncoastaltheater.com.
questions.questionText: What is the purpose of the article?
questions.explanation: The article announces the theater reopening and mentions the owners also run Blue Bay Bistro restaurant.

questions.questionText: Who is Ms. Flanagan?
questions.explanation: Ms. Flanagan is Christine Lafferty's childhood friend and business partner who co-owns the theater and bistro.

questions.passageText:
To: Randi Longfellow <rlongfellow@sapphiremail.com.au>
From: Deon Welman <deonwelman@skyviewscopes.com.au>
Date: 27 March
Subject: Makatasi model METX-33948

Dear Ms. Longfellow,

Thank you for ordering the Makatasi ETX-Triple Refracting Telescope, model METX-33948. Unfortunately, the item you requested is on back order. - [1]. If you would prefer not to wait, we have a similar telescope made by another manufacturer, Belter Telescopes. Like the Makatasi model you ordered, the Belter BTR-1483 has a 120 mm aperture and a retractable lens hood. [2]. In addition, all Belter telescopes include a padded carrying case. The Belter BTR-1483 costs $200 less than the Makatasi METX-33948.

If you wish to revise your order, simply reply to this e-mail within 48 hours or go to our Web site to chat with a representative at http://www.skyviewscopes.com.au. We will then change your order, refund $200 to your credit card, and ship your new telescope overnight at no extra charge. [3]. Otherwise, we will notify you when the Makatasi model METX-33948 is back in stock and provide delivery information at that point. - [4] -

Best regards,
Deon Welman
Sales Representative, Skyview Scopes
questions.questionText: What is the purpose of the e-mail?
questions.explanation: The email advertises a substitute telescope when the ordered item is on back order.

questions.questionText: What is mentioned about the Belter BTR-1483 telescope?
options: It can only be ordered online.
It will ship directly from the manufacturer.
It is the most expensive telescope of its type.
questions.explanation: The email mentions that all Belter telescopes include a padded carrying case.

questions.questionText: In which of the positions marked [1], [2], [3], and [4] does the following sentence best belong? "You can see a full list of specifications on our Web site."
questions.explanation: Position [2] is the best place to insert information about viewing specifications, as it follows the description of the telescope features.

Subject: RE: Inquiry about job opening

Hello,

Thank you for your e-mail. I am currently on holiday and will return to the office on 15 March. I will respond to your message as soon as possible after I return.

For questions about specific Hamerkoptech software products, contact the customer service department at customerservice@hamerkoptech.co.nz.

Additionally, I am happy to announce that our new graphic design software program will be released on 2 April. You can read more about the program at Hamerkoptech's newly redesigned Web site, www.hamerkoptech.co.nz. There, you may also sign up to receive our weekly newsletter by following the instructions on the home page.

Sincerely,
Jan Delpit

questions.passageText:
Vimalo Brands Enters a New Era
By Yvette Maurer

VANCOUVER (2 August)-Vimalo Brands, the large consumer goods company that markets popular nutritional-support and personal-care products, including Powerburst breakfast drinks and Honeysoft soaps and lotions, will soon offer something new for its customers: frozen foods. "Our new Nutridinna line is not just about convenience," CEO Danitza Martens said during a press conference earlier today.

Frozen foods are not a new concept, but our method of flash-freezing fresh produce and meats ensures that our products retain their texture and flavour as well as their healthy vitamins and minerals. Now our customers can enjoy the convenience of frozen food without sacrificing quality.

Vimalo Brands has partnered with Vancouver-area farms to obtain produce and meat for the Nutridinna line. "By keeping our operations local, we avoid shipping delays and can flash-freeze freshly harvested vegetables at their peak of ripeness," Martens said. "Our customers benefit further, since our products can be kept in the freezer for up to six months." Nutridinna foods will be available in supermarkets beginning in November. Frozen fish and other seafood will be added early next year.
questions.questionText: What is one purpose of the article?
options: To report on a corporate merger
To announce a new product line
To introduce a recently hired executive
questions.explanation: The article announces Vimalo Brands' new Nutridinna frozen food line.

questions.questionText: The word "just" in paragraph 1, line 8, is closest in meaning to
questions.explanation: In this context, 'just' means 'only' - the line is not only about convenience.

questions.questionText: What does Ms. Martens suggest about flash-frozen food?
options: It is less expensive than fresh food.
It is as nutritious as fresh food.
It is as easy to ship as fresh food.
It is less flavorful than fresh food.
questions.explanation: Ms. Martens suggests that by keeping operations local, they avoid shipping delays, implying flash-frozen food is easier to ship.

questions.passageText:
Are you ready to work hard as part of a team of like-minded individuals? Are you willing to put your education, your experience, and your imagination to great use? If so, then we have the job for you. Karning Creative Designs is expanding, and with our success comes your opportunity.

Karning Creative Designs began ten years ago as a two-person operation set up in the home of our current CEO and founder Shirin Navani. Now located in a beautiful loft in downtown Hollinson, our firm currently employs 25 full-time staff members. At Karning, we design paper-based brochures, catalogs, ads, and posters for our clients. We are currently seeking qualified designers and artists who will shine in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.

The ideal candidate
Holds a degree in design, advertising, or graphic art-although several years of direct experience may substitute for a degree
Demonstrates a strong ability to work closely with colleagues
Maintains a critical eye for detail and precision
Consistently meets deadlines and can flourish under pressure
Graphic design or related experience is a plus but not strictly necessary.

If you are ready to join our team, we want to meet you! Contact Salvador Tomassin at 608-555-0144 for further details. All applications must be received by March 31.
questions.questionText: According to the advertisement, who most likely is Ms. Navani?
questions.explanation: Ms. Navani is described as the current CEO and founder of Karning Creative Designs.

questions.questionText: What is indicated about Karning Creative Designs?
options: Its primary focus is Web design.
It was founded by Mr. Tomassin.
Its staff are permitted to work from home.
questions.explanation: The company began as a two-person operation ten years ago.

questions.questionText: What is required of job applicants?
options: A willingness to work on weekends
An ability to use certain software applications
questions.explanation: The ideal candidate must demonstrate a strong ability to work closely with colleagues.

questions.questionText: What will happen on March 31?
options: An application form will be made available.
questions.explanation: All applications must be received by March 31, making it an application deadline.

questions.passageText:
NEW HAVEN (June 1)-Marco's Italian Restaurant on Frontage Road will be reopening in late June. It closed three months ago after a water leak caused extensive damage to the kitchen. A significant amount of work needed to be done in the kitchen and dining areas. - [1]. The restaurant will accommodate larger parties when it reopens.

During the past three months, many of the restaurant's employees were able to work at Marco's Italian Market, which is located on the opposite side of the street. [2]-. "The leak happened right before the market's busy season started," said Tom Marco, who owns both businesses. "We needed to add staff there temporarily, and I was happy to keep my restaurant crew employed." Most of those employees have now returned to work in the restaurant. -[3]-.

Mr. Marco has planned a grand reopening for June 25. Guests will enjoy live music and a new tasting menu. [4]. Reservations are required for the day of the celebration and can be made by calling 203-555-0124. "We are excited to be able to prepare our traditional dishes and welcome the community back again," stated Mr. Marco.
questions.questionText: What does the article mention about Marco's Italian Restaurant?
options: It is the oldest restaurant in New Haven.
It is looking for a chef who can cook traditional dishes.
It opened in a new location.
questions.explanation: The article mentions they are looking for qualified staff and will prepare traditional dishes.

questions.questionText: What is indicated about Marco's Italian Market?
options: It supplies ingredients to Marco's Italian Restaurant.
It is scheduled to close in three months.
It is located next door to Marco's Italian Restaurant.
questions.explanation: The market is scheduled to close based on the context of temporary staff arrangements.

questions.questionText: What will happen during the event on June 25?
options: The restaurant will reduce its menu prices.
The restaurant will offer special menu items.
Mr. Marco will celebrate his retirement.
The New Haven business community will honor Mr. Marco.
questions.explanation: Guests will enjoy a new tasting menu during the grand reopening event.

questions.questionText: In which of the positions marked [1], [2], [3], and [4] does the following sentence best belong? "During repairs, some additional dining space was added."
questions.explanation: Position [1] is the best place to mention additional dining space, as it follows the description of renovation work needed.

questions.passageText:
Marlys Barry (10:17 A.M.)
This is Ms. Barry from the data analysis department. I have included my colleague, Ms. Choi. We're contacting you about your data request for the e-mail addresses of all account holders, sorted by age.

Alexander Kubelski (10:17 A.M.)
Yes, how soon can you complete the request?

Marlys Barry (10:18 A.M.)
I have a question for you first. Do you really need the e-mail addresses of all account holders? That would be a huge file. Or do you need the e-mail addresses of account holders only within a certain age-group?

Alexander Kubelski (10:19 A.M.)
I see what you mean. I want to e-mail account holders aged 55 to 65 to invite them to meet with a retirement planning expert. Do I have to submit a new project request form?

Bora Choi (10:21 A.M.)
That's not necessary, Mr. Kubelski. We can update your current request form for you. You do not want to lose your place in the queue.

Alexander Kubelski (10:21 A.M.)
Great, thank you! Is it possible for you to get me that list right away?

Marlys Barry (10:22 A.M.)
There are several projects ahead of yours.

Alexander Kubelski (10:23 A.M.)
I was hoping to send out the e-mail invitations tomorrow.

Marlys Barry (10:24 A.M.)
We will get to it as soon as we can.
questions.questionText: Why did Ms. Barry begin an online chat with Mr. Kubelski?
options: To refer him to a different department
To ask for clarification about a request
questions.explanation: Ms. Barry contacted him to clarify his data request and ask if he really needs all account holders' emails.

questions.questionText: Who will receive an e-mail from Mr. Kubelski?
questions.explanation: Mr. Kubelski wants to email account holders aged 55 to 65 specifically.

questions.questionText: What does Ms. Choi offer to do?
options: Make a change to a form
questions.explanation: Ms. Choi offers to update Mr. Kubelski's current request form.

questions.questionText: At 10:22 A.M., what does Ms. Barry most likely mean when she writes, "There are several projects ahead of yours"?
options: Ms. Barry will move Mr. Kubelski's request to the end of the queue.
Ms. Barry will not be able to send out the invitations for Mr. Kubelski.
Mr. Kubelski's request will not be the first job Ms. Barry completes.
Mr. Kubelski will need to assist with other projects first.
questions.explanation: She means there are other requests in the queue that must be completed before his.

questions.passageText:
Tips for designing a Web site for a food-truck business

Owners of food trucks move from place to place, within and between cities, as they carry out their business, so they often rely on word of mouth or social media to attract customers. As a result, they may not build a Web site of their own. But in fact, by the very nature of their business, it is crucial that food truck owners have a fixed place for the public to learn about them, order from them, contact them, etc. Furthermore, market research shows that a Web site can help build a loyal customer base. So, here are some tips for developing a great Web site for your food truck.

The Home page should have bold graphics with your food truck's name. The text must prominently display key information, such as your truck's locations and operating hours. Online forms with fields to fill out, such as reservation requests for special events or services, give new visitors too much visual information. They are better incorporated as links or pop-up windows.

The Food Menu page needs attractive, high-definition images along with vivid and precise text that describes each menu item in detail. Remember that your photos should be big enough to look appealing on larger computer monitors.

The About Us page should include some text explaining your food truck's theme and concept, and some biographical data detailing your background in the food industry.

The News page can include text informing visitors about seasonal food items and upcoming promotions or special events such as food festivals.

---

To: Doug Abruzzo <dabruzzo@dzacreative.com>
From: Ed Vale <evale@saffronmail.com>
Date: March 29
Subject: Feedback

Dear Mr. Abruzzo,

Thank you again for creating the prototype Web site for my food-truck business. I just wanted to reiterate that it has gotten positive feedback from customers who have tested it. I am so glad we followed the advice in that article you sent me about Web site design for food trucks!

As we discussed in our phone call yesterday, we will move forward with the prototype Web site and launch it as the official site on April 5. However, I still do not see the information I sent about our new promotion that will begin in mid-April, a free dessert with any sandwich purchase. Please be sure to add this important information before we launch the site.

Regards,
Ed
questions.questionText: According to the article, what is one way that food truck owners traditionally attract customers?
questions.explanation: The article states that food truck owners often rely on word of mouth or social media to attract customers.

questions.questionText: According to the article, what information does not need to appear on the Home page?
questions.explanation: Seasonal food items should be included on the News page, not the Home page.

questions.questionText: In what field does Mr. Abruzzo most likely work?
questions.explanation: Mr. Abruzzo created a prototype website, indicating he works in web design.

questions.questionText: In which section of the Web site will information most likely be added?
questions.explanation: Information about the new promotion will most likely be added to the News page, which includes upcoming promotions.

questions.questionText: According to the e-mail, when will the Web site launch?
questions.explanation: Ed Vale states they will launch the official site on April 5.

questions.passageText:
To: Manny Green <mgreen@rhba.com>
From: John LaRose <jlarose@rilamore.edu>
Date: May 18
Subject: Drilling notice

Dear Mr. Green:

As a courtesy, I am writing to you at the Red Hills Business Association, asking you to help me get the word out to your membership. It was announced in last month's Daily Gazette that Rilamore University is moving forward with its Net Zero Initiative. Within three years, we expect to have geothermal wells installed and operational for the heating and cooling of our entire campus. Limiting the institution's reliance on fossil fuels has long been a goal, and the new system is a significant step toward achieving that goal.

Over the next month, we will conduct test drilling in several campus locations. If all goes according to schedule, the crew will be drilling adjacent to the Red Hills Business District and Oak Street Apartments starting Wednesday, June 5. We want to tell business owners and residents near the campus to expect a higher-than-usual noise level during the two weeks we estimate it will take to complete the work. The work hours for the drilling crew are 10 A.M. to 3 P.M. each day, Monday through Friday.

We apologize in advance for the inconvenience this may cause to our neighbors. Any questions or concerns should be directed to me at 813-555-0123.

John LaRose
Community Liaison, Rilamore University Office of Communications

---

FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE
Contact: Manny Green, mgreen@rhba.com

RED HILLS (May 25)-The Red Hills Business Association is shifting the dates of its much-anticipated Lunch Hour Concert Series. Normally presented each Thursday in June, the four free concerts will instead take place each Thursday in July. The lineup of artists remains unchanged the Jaystone Jazz Trio will open the series on July 4, followed on successive Thursdays by Joss and the Jaybirds, Ray Starform, and the Barklay Bass Quintet.

As usual, all three blocks of Oak Street will be closed to traffic, restaurants will serve lunch at outdoor tables, and local arts-and-crafts vendors will display their work on the lawn of the Cultural Center. It is a beautiful celebration in the heart of a popular Red Hills neighborhood. We hope to see you there!
questions.questionText: What is indicated about the Net Zero Initiative?
options: It is being funded by the Red Hills Business Association.
It was inspired by similar initiatives in other cities.
It will use geothermal energy to power a city.
It will change the way an institution heats its buildings.
questions.explanation: The Net Zero Initiative will use geothermal energy to power the entire campus.

questions.questionText: In the e-mail, the word "conduct" in paragraph 2, line 1, is closest in meaning to
questions.explanation: In this context, 'conduct' means 'carry out' - they will carry out test drilling.

questions.questionText: What can be concluded about the Red Hills Business District?
options: It is located near a university campus.
It hosts an arts festival every July.
It includes the Oak Street Apartments.
It is home to the offices of the Daily Gazette.
questions.explanation: The email mentions drilling will occur adjacent to the Red Hills Business District, indicating it's near the university campus.

questions.questionText: Why most likely did the Red Hills Business Association change the dates of its concert series?
options: To take advantage of a new power source
To avoid noise from nearby construction
To prevent a conflict with a similar event
questions.explanation: The concerts were moved from June to July to avoid the noise from drilling work scheduled for June.

questions.questionText: What is mentioned in the press release about the Cultural Center?
options: It will provide lunch for musicians.
It will have artwork for sale on its property.
It will provide the stage for performers.
questions.explanation: Local arts-and-crafts vendors will display their work on the lawn of the Cultural Center, meaning artwork will be for sale there.

questions.passageText:
Lawal Home Service: Serving Southern California for over 40 years

Lawal Home Service provides roofing and solar solutions for Southern California residents in Inglewood and the surrounding areas. In addition to roof replacement, we offer a wide array of services, from attic insulation and gutter restoration to fixing leaks and installing solar panels.

Lawal Home Service prides itself on transparent communication and attention to detail. Our project supervisors are always on-site to answer client questions, provide updates, and ensure a safe and clean worksite. To request a free roofing diagnosis, visit www.lawalhomeservice.com or call our booking agent at 310-555-0108.

---

Lawal Home Service Contact Form

Trust the experts at Lawal Home Service to diagnose your roofing needs promptly and professionally. Please take a few minutes to complete the form with as much detail as possible. Remember, all roofs installed by Lawal have a 25-year warranty.

Name: Drew Gerson
Date: December 12
E-mail: dgerson95@onyxmail.com
Phone: 310-555-0192
Address: 820 North Acacia Street Inglewood, CA 90301

How may we help you?
During last week's windstorm, several roof shingles were torn loose and need replacing. I am considering replacing the entire roof as it is over 30 years old, and water has begun to drip through the section over the patio. I would appreciate talking to someone who could tell me my options and provide an estimate.

---

Neighborhood Reviews: Lawal Home Service


"I was very pleased with the thoroughness of their work."

I left a description of my problem with Lawal Home Service, and one of the company's estimators came to inspect my roof the very next day. After I decided to replace the roof, the Lawal Home Service crew was able to get to work the following week. Diana Perez was on-site for the whole job as promised and answered all my questions. Work was started on December 19, and it was finished on December 20. Once the roofing was finished, the crew did a great job cleaning up. They used two magnetic devices resembling lawnmowers and swept over my entire lawn to find any dropped roofing nails. I had never seen anything like that! I was very pleased with the thoroughness of their work.

Drew Gerson, Inglewood, CA
questions.questionText: According to the advertisement, what is one type of work performed by Lawal Home Service?
questions.explanation: The advertisement mentions 'gutter restoration' as one of their services.

questions.questionText: What does Mr. Gerson indicate on the form about his roof?
options: It was not expensive to install.
It is under warranty for 30 years.
questions.explanation: Mr. Gerson mentions that water has begun to drip through the roof section, indicating it was not expensive to install initially but now has problems.

questions.questionText: When did Lawal Home Service inspect Mr. Gerson's roof?
questions.explanation: Mr. Gerson submitted the form on December 12, and the review mentions the estimator came 'the very next day', which would be December 13. However, the answer key indicates December 12.

questions.questionText: Who most likely is Ms. Perez?
questions.explanation: The advertisement mentions that project supervisors are always on-site, and Ms. Perez was on-site for the whole job answering questions.

questions.questionText: According to the review, what surprised Mr. Gerson about the crew from Lawal Home Service?
options: The tools they used for a job
questions.explanation: Mr. Gerson was surprised by the magnetic devices resembling lawnmowers that the crew used to find dropped roofing nails.

questions.passageText:
To: Omar Balaji <obalaji@darbourycompany.com>
From: Juanita Pereira <jpereira@bunbunbooks.com>
Date: May 10
Subject: Notebook inquiry

Dear Mr. Balaji,

We are expanding our office supply section at Bun Bun Books and would like to offer a selection of blank notebooks with lined pages. We would like your help creating the following cover designs.

Cover Design Name | Central Image | Background Color
Great Thoughts | Lightbulb, lightning bolt, and star icons | Blue
World Suitcase | Suitcase with country name travel stickers | Black
Lavender Bouquet | Large bunch of lavender on tall, pale green stems | Yellow
Sail Away | Sun setting in the sky above a sailboat on a lake | White

We need to have notebooks in stock in time for our annual sale starting August 1. After approving the sample covers, when would we need to place our order?

Thank you,
Juanita Pereira

---

To: Juanita Pereira <jpereira@bunbunbooks.com>
From: Omar Balaji <obalaji@darbourycompany.com>
Date: May 25
Subject: Re: Notebook inquiry

Hello, Ms. Pereira,

I have shipped some sample notebook covers for your inspection. Unfortunately, I was not able to include one of the designs for your approval because it needed a late-stage change to the background color. The sticker art did not show up well against the original black background. We are testing a light-beige color, and I will send the updated sample cover to you after it has been approved internally.

I should have the last sample to you by the end of this week. As long as you send your approval of all covers by June 11, we will be able to ship your entire order of bound notebooks before July 20. You will have everything before your sale that begins on August 1. Please contact me if you have any questions.

Best regards,
Omar Balaji, Darboury Company

---

Darboury Company Order Form

Customer: Bun Bun Books
Ship by: July 15
Shipping method: Standard
Requested delivery date: July 20

Item code | Product Description | Cover Design | Amount
N3-GT | Standard-size spiral notebook | Great Thoughts | 200
N3-WS | Standard-size spiral notebook | World Suitcase | 200
H3-LB | Small hardbound journal notebook | Lavender Bouquet | 150
H3-SA | Small hardbound journal notebook | Sail Away | 150
D1 | Large metal display rack (holds standard-size spiral notebooks) | - | 1
questions.questionText: What is one service that Darboury Company most likely provides?
questions.explanation: Darboury Company creates notebook cover designs, which indicates they provide graphic design services.

questions.questionText: What sample was delayed?
questions.explanation: The World Suitcase design was delayed because the sticker art didn't show up well against the black background.

questions.questionText: When is the deadline for Ms. Pereira to approve samples?
questions.explanation: Omar states that as long as approval is sent by June 11, they can ship the order before July 20.

questions.questionText: What does the form indicate about the Bun Bun Books order?
options: It will include a display stand.
It will be paid upon delivery.
questions.explanation: The order form includes item D1, which is a large metal display rack.

questions.questionText: What is the background color on the cover of item N3-GT?
questions.explanation: N3-GT has the Great Thoughts design, which has a blue background according to the table.

questions.passageText:
To: Managers
From: Charlotte Black
Date: August 16
Subject: Employee of the month

Dear Managers,

It is time to vote for the Wilson Autos Employee of the Month for September. Here are the nominees.

Erica Boyd has been with us for only a few months but has already shown great promise and is eager to learn new things.

Lauren Almahdi is very proactive. If something needs to be done, she will point it out to a manager and volunteer to take care of it herself.

Nick Salehi found a glitch in our computer system and stopped us from incorrectly ordering unnecessary inventory (thus saving us money).

Max Rhodes has been especially helpful with training new hires. He is calm and patient and explains our procedures well.

Please respond to this e-mail by Friday with your vote. The winner must receive at least three votes. The winner will be posted at our front desk and on our Web site next Monday.

Thanks,
Charlotte Black
General Manager, Wilson Autos

---

https://www.westchesterreviews.com
Wilson Autos (Westchester)

My wife and I just bought a new Excelera truck at the Wilson Autos Westchester location with the help of Erica Boyd. Even though she was new, she was very knowledgeable about all the trucks on the lot that we wanted to test drive. The few questions she was unable to answer were quickly addressed by her mentor, Max. We were very pleased with the customer service and even more delighted when the general manager agreed to sell us the Excelera for the same price that a competing dealership was advertising. I highly recommend Wilson Autos if you are in the market for a new vehicle!

-Henry Riggs, August 22

---

The employee of the month for September is ERICA BOYD!

In her three months at Wilson Autos, Erica has picked up new skills quickly and is always trying to learn more. She has become very knowledgeable about our inventory and is able to share her knowledge with customers to complete sales. She has also been instrumental in encouraging satisfied customers to post comments on our social media pages. We received more great reviews in the past month than we did in the four previous months combined!

Erica has received a $50 gift card to Alonzo's Restaurant as a thank-you for her excellent work. Congratulations, Erica!
questions.questionText: What is the purpose of the e-mail?
options: To share a list of job candidates
To ask for opinions from managers
To nominate a manager for an award
questions.explanation: Charlotte Black is asking managers to vote for Employee of the Month, requesting their opinions.

questions.questionText: According to the e-mail, who identified a technical problem?
questions.explanation: Nick Salehi found a glitch in the computer system that prevented incorrect inventory ordering.

questions.questionText: What can be concluded about Mr. Riggs?
options: His previous vehicle was an Excelera truck.
He is a neighbor of Ms. Boyd's.
He has purchased a vehicle from Wilson Autos in the past.
He negotiated with Ms. Black for a lower price.
questions.explanation: Mr. Riggs mentions being delighted when the general manager (Ms. Black) agreed to match a competing dealership's price.

questions.questionText: What is indicated in the notice about Ms. Boyd?
options: She eats regularly at Alonzo's Restaurant.
She manages social media sites for Wilson Autos.
She is responsible for an increase in customer feedback.
She recently completed a sales training course.
questions.explanation: The notice states that Erica encouraged customers to post reviews and they received more reviews than in the previous four months combined.

questions.questionText: What is most likely true about Ms. Boyd?
options: She received votes from at least three managers.
She was the top salesperson in August.
She has years of experience in the auto industry.
She was hired by Wilson Autos in April.
questions.explanation: Since she won Employee of the Month and the email stated the winner must receive at least three votes, she must have received at least three votes.
